State University of New York at New Paltz official policy on generative AI Artificial Intelligence
http://www.cs.newpaltz.edu/~lik/

[Life in one paragraph]
(一段人生)


Professor Keqin Li 
was born in

Songjiang
(松江)
(a

historical and cultural city),
Shanghai, China, on May 26,
1963.
He grew up in and graduated from the 
Songjiang County Organ Nursery
(松江县级机关托儿所)
in
1969.
He graduated from
Songjiang Zhongshan Elementary School
(松江中山小学)
(a

historically well-known elementary school)
in
1975
(reunion
with classmates and teachers in 2013),
Songjiang No. 2 Middle School
(松江二中初中部)
in
1978
(reunion
with classmates and teachers in 2012),
and
Shanghai Songjiang No. 2 Senior High School
(松江二中高中部)
(one of

the best high schools
in Shanghai)
in
1980
(reunion with classmates and teachers in
2011
and
2016).
Here are some photos taken during the summer of 2014:
[1],
[2],
[3].



He received a B.S. degree in
computer science
from 
Tsinghua University
(清华大学),
Beijing, China, in
1985,
with a
thesis
entitled
"A multiversion concurrency control algorithm for file management in distributed computer systems",
and a Ph.D. degree in
computer science
from the 
University of Houston
(休斯顿大学),
Houston, Texas, USA, in 1990,
with a
dissertation
entitled
"Dynamic resource allocation and job scheduling in partitionable mesh connected systems".


He started his research career in 1985.
This is his
first paper 
written at the age of 22.


He was an assistant professor (1990-1996),
an associate professor (1996-1999),
and a full professor (1999-2009)
of computer science with the

State University of New York at New Paltz.
On March 24, 2009,
he was appointed by the Board of Trustees of the State University of New York
to the rank of

SUNY Distinguished Professor
(纽约州立大学终身讲席教授),
the state university's highest faculty designation.
During 2011-2014, he was an
Intellectual Ventures
endowed visiting chair professor
(清华大学高智讲座教授)
at the 
National Laboratory for Information Science and Technology,
Tsinghua University, Beijing, China.


He has published over 990 journal articles, book chapters, and refereed conference papers,
with over 700 articles published in 170 different research journals
and over 300 publications in 60 different ACM/IEEE transactions and journals.
His papers appeared in the inaugural issues of
IEEE-TCC
(2013)
and
IEEE-TSUSC
(2016).
His papers have been included in the best papers collections of numerous conferences
(国际会议最佳论文集),
including
HPCS 1997,
PMEO-PDS 2002,
WMN 2003,
PMEO-PDS 2004,
IPDPS 2004,
PMEO 2008,
WWASN 2009,
PMEO 2010,
APDCM 2010,
APDCM 2011,
HPGC 2011,
PMAM 2014.
He holds nearly 75 patents
announced or authorized by the
Chinese National Intellectual Property Administration.


He is currently among the world's top five most influential scientists
in parallel and distributed computing
in terms of both single-year impact and career-long impact
based on a composite indicator of the Scopus citation database
(并行和分布式计算领域全球最具影响力的学者).


He has chaired over 20 international conferences,
and has served in the editorial/advisory board of 18 research journals,
including ACM-CSUR, IEEE-TPDS, IEEE-TC, IEEE-TCC, IEEE-TSC, IEEE-TSUSC, CCF-THPC.
He has been on the IEEE Computer Society
Fellow Evaluating Committee
(2015-2024)
and the
IEEE Senior Member Application Review Panel
(2023).


He was a founding member of the Board of Directors (1999)
and served as the principal of the

Mid-Hudson Huaxia Chinese School
(赫德逊华夏中文学校校长,
2004-2007)
and received the
Outstanding Service Award
of
Huaxia Chinese School,
the largest Chinese education organization in overseas China.
He was also the president (Chair of Deacon Board) of the
Mid-Hudson Chinese Christian Church
(赫德逊华语基督教会执事会主席,
2010-2011).


Here are his
[DBLP],
[Google Scholar],
[ORCID],
[Scopus],
[SciProfiles],
[Wikipedia].


Professor Keqin Li 
has received several best paper awards
(最佳论文奖),
including
PDPTA 1996,
NAECON 1997,
IPDPS 2000,
ISPA 2016,
NPC 2019,
ISPA 2019,
CPSCom 2022.


Professor Li received the
Distinguished Faculty Medallion
(杰出教授奖章,
specifically commissioned to commemorate this distinction)
during the
SUNY distinguished dinner and ceremony
in Albany, New York, on May 3, 2010.


He has been a Member of the
SUNY Distinguished Academy
(纽约州立大学杰出学院院士)
since its establishment in May 2012.


On November 24, 2014,
Professor Li was
notified
by J. Roberto B. de Marca, IEEE President and CEO,
that he has been elevated to
IEEE Fellow
(国际电气和电子工程师协会会士),
effective 1 January 2015, with the following citation:

for contributions to parallel and distributed computing.
During 1999-2014,
only 0.07% (7 out of 10,000) of IEEE members were elevated to the Fellow grade each year.


He is a 2017
recipient
of the
Albert Nelson Marquis Lifetime Achievement Award
(阿尔伯特·尼尔森·马奎斯终身成就奖)
for being listed in
Marquis
Who's Who in Science and Engineering
(科学与工程名人录),
Who's Who in America
(美国名人录),
Who's Who in the World
(世界名人录),
and Who's Who in American Education
(美国教育界名人录)
for more than 20 consecutive years.


He was a
Distinguished Speaker
(lecture available at

学堂在线)
in the
60th Anniversary Celebration
of the Department of Computer Science and Technology at Tsinghua University
(清华大学计算机系六十周年系庆杰出讲演者),
his alma mater,
on
May 22, 2018.
He received the Distinguished Alumnus Award
(休斯顿大学杰出校友奖)
in the 50th Anniversary Celebration
of the Computer Science Department at the University of Houston
on October 20, 2018.


He is listed in the


World's Top 2% Scientists
(世界顶尖科学家在线查询)
by 

Stanford University
and Elsevier's


Mendeley Data
(version 6)
and Scopus citation database
on October 4, 2023,
using a composite indicator that considers and combines six citation metrics
for 9,617,763 scientists and scholars who have published at least five papers.

Based on single-year (2022) impact
(2022年度科学影响力排行榜),
he is ranked #1 in the US and #2 in the world
among 9,403 scientists and researchers in his subfield - parallel and distributed computing
(并行和分布式计算领域全美第一名及全球第二名).

Based on career-long (1960-2022) impact
(终身科学影响力排行榜),
he is ranked #3 in the US and #4 in the world in his subfield
(并行和分布式计算领域全美第三名及全球第四名).



He is among the 6 only computer scientists globally and historically (as of 2022),
each has more than 140 single-authored papers and has a composite indicator greater than 4.0.
(全球论文最多及影响最大的计算机科学家)


On June 17, 2022,
Professor Li was notified by President Marja Makarow
that he has been elected to be a
Member
of
Academia Europaea
(The Academy of Europe,
欧洲人文和自然科学院院士).
During 1988-2022 (35 years),
the number of US scholars in informatics (computer science)
who earned the honor of MAE is only 37.
(欧洲科学院信息科学部美籍院士名单)


He became a
Fellow
of the Asia-Pacific Artificial Intelligence Association
(AAIA,
亚太人工智能协会会士)
in July 2022.


On November 30, 2022,
Professor Li was
notified
by Sudip Parikh, AAAS Chief Executive Officer,
that he has been elevated to the rank of
AAAS Fellow
(美国科学促进会院士),
with the following citation:


For distinguished contributions to the field of parallel and distributed computing,
particularly for parallel algorithms design, energy-efficient computing techniques development, and theoretical modeling and analytical optimization of cloud computing systems.
(美国科学促进会华裔院士名单
(1983-2023))



He received the
IEEE TCCLD Research Impact Award
(IEEE 云计算技术委员会研究影响力奖)
on December 10, 2022
from the IEEE Computer Society Technical Committee on Cloud Computing for his

significant, systematic, and sustained contributions
to modeling, analysis, and optimization of cloud computing systems.


On June 9, 2023,
it was announced that
Professor Li was the recipient of the

2023 IEEE TCSVC Research Innovation Award (RIA)
(IEEE 服务计算技术委员会研究创新奖)
of the IEEE Computer Society Technical Community on Services Computing (TCSVC)
for his 

outstanding contributions to services computing,
particularly to analytical investigation in cloud computing and combinatorial optimization in mobile edge computing.


On November 6, 2023,
Professor Li was notified
by Bala Prasanna (IEEE Region 1 Director-Elect 2022-23) that 
he has been selected as a recipient of the 2023
IEEE Region 1 (Northeastern US) 
Technological Innovation Award (Academic)
(IEEE 1 区(美国东北部)
技术创新奖(学术))
for his


extraordinary contributions to parallel and distributed computing.


He has been a Founding Fellow
of the Asia Computational Intelligence Society
(ACIS,
亚洲计算智能学会创始会士)
since November 7, 2023.


On November 30, 2023,
he was elected as a World's AI Top Scientist
(世界人工智能顶尖科学家)
and an Academician Member
(院士成员)
of the International Artificial Intelligence Industry Alliance
(AIIA).


On February 5, 2024,
it was announced
by the Department of Science and Technology of Hunan Province
that Professor Li was a recipient of the 2023 Xiaoxiang Friendship Award
(潇湘友谊奖)
for his important contributions to scientific and technological innovation in Hunan Province.


Here are his awards in China:
[2019年湖南省高等教育教学成果二等奖],
[2020年湖南省自然科学一等奖],
[2021年湖南省自然科学二等奖],
[2023年湖南省潇湘友谊奖].


Family
(家庭)


Professor Li is married with 
Ling Gao
(高玲),
a 
Tsinghua alumna.
She was a software engineer in
Konica Minolta USA
(1994-1997),
and a staff/advisory/senior software engineer in
IBM
(1997-2023).

This is Ling (front, center) in her dance team performance show:
"Kite"
(风筝)
during 2019 Chinese New Year celebration,
and
"Swan Goose"
(鸿雁)
during 2024 Chinese New Year celebration.


They have three children.


Andrew
(李安迪),
the oldest, is currently
a 
BP America Assistant Professor

(BP讲座助理教授,

BP Junior Faculty Endowed Chair,
Career Development Chair)

of 
Operations Research
at the Tepper School of Business
(with 9 Nobel Laureates),
Carnegie Mellon University
(卡内基·梅隆大学).

He received his Ph.D. degree from the
Operations Research Center (ORC)
at
Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT)
(麻省理工学院)
under the supervision of Professor Vivek F. Farias.

He received his B.S. degree 
(Summa Cum Laude,
meaning "with the highest honor" in Latin and GPA top 1%,
最高荣誉生)
from
Columbia University
(哥伦比亚大学)
with a major in financial engineering and a minor in applied mathematics.
He is a
member of 
Tau Beta Pi,
and a recipient of the
Sebastian B. Littauer Award
from the Fu Foundation School of Engineering and Applied Science
in recognition of his superior achievement
and outstanding promise of scholarly and professional achievement in operations research.
He was an awardee of

National Defense Science and Engineering Graduate (NDSEG) Fellowships
(美国国防科学与工程研究生全额奖学金).


Andrew was the winner of the MIT ORC Best Ph.D. Student Paper Award
(麻省理工学院运筹学研究中心最佳博士论文奖)
in 2017
and INFORMS

George Nicholson Student Paper Competition
(First Place,
国际运筹学与管理科学学会博士论文竞赛第一名)
in
2017.
This is his

award winning paper
(and its

supplemental materials)
published in
Management Science.
He won the INFORMS

Pierskalla Best Paper Award
in 2021.
His papers have received five best paper awards/prizes and have been three other best paper award/prize finalists.


Andrew received the US National Science Foundation
Career Award
(2023-2028, 美国国家科学基金会杰青,
CMU News).


This is Andrew's
first paper
published in

Discrete Mathematics,
written at the age of (younger than) 21
with Professor
Charles R. Johnson,
the Class of 1961 Professor at College of William and Mary,
and Andrew's research advisor during a summer research program.


This is Andrew's
second paper
published in

Performance Evaluation,
written at the age of (younger than) 22
with Professor
Ward Whitt,
a member of US National Academy of Engineering,
and Andrew's research advisor at Columbia University.


This is Andrew's most recent

NeurIPS 2021 paper
(9122 submissions, acceptance rate < 1%)
and his featured
NeurIPS 2022 paper.


Here is a photo
of Andrew and his MIT classmates/friends
taken in Spring 2013 in front of their dorm.


Charlotte
(李恩惠),
the second child,
is currently a senior manager of partnerships and business accounts at Jiko,
an innovative financial technology company headquartered in San Francisco, CA.
She
graduated
with B.S. degree from
Columbia University
(哥伦比亚大学)
in May 2015
with a major in engineering management systems and a minor in economics
and another minor in entrepreneurship and innovation.
She was the secretary (2013-2014) and president (2014-2015) of

Columbia Women's Business Society (CWBS),
the largest pre-professional group at Columbia University.
She was an actuarial consultant in the Actuarial, Rewards & Analytics group of
Deloitte Consulting LLP,
the largest professional services firm in the world by revenue,
New York, NY, during 2015-2018;
and a business development manager  at
Credit Karma, Inc.,
San Francisco, CA, during 2018-2022.

during February 2014.

with a major in

and a minor in music.

Recent Journal Articles
(最近学术期刊论文)



Professor Keqin Li's
current research interests include
cloud computing,
fog computing and mobile edge computing,
energy-efficient computing and communication,
embedded systems and cyber-physical systems,
heterogeneous computing systems,
big data computing,
high-performance computing,
CPU-GPU hybrid and cooperative computing,
computer architectures and systems,
computer networking,
machine learning,
intelligent and soft computing.


See [ORCID]
for a more comprehensive elaboration of Professor Keqin Li's scientific contributions.

(ICSAI-2022),
Kunming, Yunnan, China, December 10-12, 2022.


Program Chair of
2022 IEEE Hyper-Intelligence Congress
(including
HPCC-2022,
DSS-2022,
SmartCity-2022,
DependSys-2022,
ICESS-2022,
DIKW-2022),
Chengdu, Sichuan, China, December 18-20, 2022. 


General Chair of
the 9th IEEE International Conference on Edge Computing and Scalable Cloud
(IEEE EdgeCom 2023),
Xiangtan, Hunan, China, July 1-3, 2023.


Honorary Chair of
the 2024 International Conference on Computer and Multimedia Technology
(ICCMT 2024),
Sanming, Fujian, China, April 12-14, 2024.


Honorary Chair of
the 3rd International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, Internet of Things and Cloud Computing Technology
(AIoTC 2024),
Wuhan, China, September 13-15, 2024.


Honorary Chair of
the 24th IEEE International Conference on Scalable Computing and Communications (ScalCom 2024),
Denarau Island, Fiji, December 2-7, 2024.


Keynote Speaker of
9th International Conference on Green, Pervasive and Cloud Computing
(GPC 2014),
Wuhan, China, May 26-28, 2014.


Keynote Speaker of
6th IEEE Workshop on Parallel Computing and Optimization
(PCO 2016),
Chicago, Illinois, USA, May 23, 2016.




Keynote Speaker of
16th IEEE/ACIS International Conference on Software Engineering Research, Management and Applications
(SERA 2018),
Kunming, Yunnan, China, June 13-15, 2018.
[IEEE Xplore]


Keynote Speaker of
20th IEEE International Conference on High Performance Computing and Communications
(HPCC-2018),
Exeter, England, UK, 28-30 June 2018.











天行健,
君子以自强不息;



地势坤,
君子以厚德载物.








He has been a Member of the
SUNY Distinguished Academy
(纽约州立大学杰出学院院士)
since its establishment in May 2012.


On November 24, 2014,
Professor Li was
notified
by J. Roberto B. de Marca, IEEE President and CEO,
that he has been elevated to
IEEE Fellow
(国际电气和电子工程师协会会士),
effective 1 January 2015, with the following citation:

for contributions to parallel and distributed computing.
During 1999-2014,
only 0.07% (7 out of 10,000) of IEEE members were elevated to the Fellow grade each year.


He is a 2017
recipient
of the
Albert Nelson Marquis Lifetime Achievement Award
(阿尔伯特·尼尔森·马奎斯终身成就奖)
for being listed in
Marquis
Who's Who in Science and Engineering
(科学与工程名人录),
Who's Who in America
(美国名人录),
Who's Who in the World
(世界名人录),
and Who's Who in American Education
(美国教育界名人录)
for more than 20 consecutive years.


He was a
Distinguished Speaker
(lecture available at

学堂在线)
in the
60th Anniversary Celebration
of the Department of Computer Science and Technology at Tsinghua University
(清华大学计算机系六十周年系庆杰出讲演者),
his alma mater,
on
May 22, 2018.
He received the Distinguished Alumnus Award
(休斯顿大学杰出校友奖)
in the 50th Anniversary Celebration
of the Computer Science Department at the University of Houston
on October 20, 2018.


He is listed in the


World's Top 2% Scientists
(世界顶尖科学家在线查询)
by 

Stanford University
and Elsevier's


Mendeley Data
(version 6)
and Scopus citation database
on October 4, 2023,
using a composite indicator that considers and combines six citation metrics
for 9,617,763 scientists and scholars who have published at least five papers.

Based on single-year (2022) impact
(2022年度科学影响力排行榜),
he is ranked #1 in the US and #2 in the world
among 9,403 scientists and researchers in his subfield - parallel and distributed computing
(并行和分布式计算领域全美第一名及全球第二名).

Based on career-long (1960-2022) impact
(终身科学影响力排行榜),
he is ranked #3 in the US and #4 in the world in his subfield
(并行和分布式计算领域全美第三名及全球第四名).



He is among the 6 only computer scientists globally and historically (as of 2022),
each has more than 140 single-authored papers and has a composite indicator greater than 4.0.
(全球论文最多及影响最大的计算机科学家)


On June 17, 2022,
Professor Li was notified by President Marja Makarow
that he has been elected to be a
Member
of
Academia Europaea
(The Academy of Europe,
欧洲人文和自然科学院院士).
During 1988-2022 (35 years),
the number of US scholars in informatics (computer science)
who earned the honor of MAE is only 37.
(欧洲科学院信息科学部美籍院士名单)


He became a
Fellow
of the Asia-Pacific Artificial Intelligence Association
(AAIA,
亚太人工智能协会会士)
in July 2022.


On November 30, 2022,
Professor Li was
notified
by Sudip Parikh, AAAS Chief Executive Officer,
that he has been elevated to the rank of
AAAS Fellow
(美国科学促进会院士),
with the following citation:


For distinguished contributions to the field of parallel and distributed computing,
particularly for parallel algorithms design, energy-efficient computing techniques development, and theoretical modeling and analytical optimization of cloud computing systems.
(美国科学促进会华裔院士名单
(1983-2023))



He received the
IEEE TCCLD Research Impact Award
(IEEE 云计算技术委员会研究影响力奖)
on December 10, 2022
from the IEEE Computer Society Technical Committee on Cloud Computing for his

significant, systematic, and sustained contributions
to modeling, analysis, and optimization of cloud computing systems.


On June 9, 2023,
it was announced that
Professor Li was the recipient of the

2023 IEEE TCSVC Research Innovation Award (RIA)
(IEEE 服务计算技术委员会研究创新奖)
of the IEEE Computer Society Technical Community on Services Computing (TCSVC)
for his 

outstanding contributions to services computing,
particularly to analytical investigation in cloud computing and combinatorial optimization in mobile edge computing.


On November 6, 2023,
Professor Li was notified
by Bala Prasanna (IEEE Region 1 Director-Elect 2022-23) that 
he has been selected as a recipient of the 2023
IEEE Region 1 (Northeastern US) 
Technological Innovation Award (Academic)
(IEEE 1 区(美国东北部)
技术创新奖(学术))
for his


extraordinary contributions to parallel and distributed computing.


He has been a Founding Fellow
of the Asia Computational Intelligence Society
(ACIS,
亚洲计算智能学会创始会士)
since November 7, 2023.


On November 30, 2023,
he was elected as a World's AI Top Scientist
(世界人工智能顶尖科学家)
and an Academician Member
(院士成员)
of the International Artificial Intelligence Industry Alliance
(AIIA).


On February 5, 2024,
it was announced
by the Department of Science and Technology of Hunan Province
that Professor Li was a recipient of the 2023 Xiaoxiang Friendship Award
(潇湘友谊奖)
for his important contributions to scientific and technological innovation in Hunan Province.


Here are his awards in China:

[2021年湖南省自然科学二等奖],
[2023年湖南省潇湘友谊奖].

(1997-2023).

They have three children.


Andrew
(李安迪),
the oldest, is currently
a 
BP America Assistant Professor

(BP讲座助理教授,

BP Junior Faculty Endowed Chair,
Career Development Chair)

of 
Operations Research
at the Tepper School of Business
(with 9 Nobel Laureates),
Carnegie Mellon University
(卡内基·梅隆大学).

He received his Ph.D. degree from the
Operations Research Center (ORC)
at
Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT)
(麻省理工学院)
under the supervision of Professor Vivek F. Farias.

He received his B.S. degree 
(Summa Cum Laude,
meaning "with the highest honor" in Latin and GPA top 1%,
最高荣誉生)
from
Columbia University
(哥伦比亚大学)
with a major in financial engineering and a minor in applied mathematics.
He is a
member of 
Tau Beta Pi,
and a recipient of the
Sebastian B. Littauer Award
from the Fu Foundation School of Engineering and Applied Science
in recognition of his superior achievement
and outstanding promise of scholarly and professional achievement in operations research.
He was an awardee of

National Defense Science and Engineering Graduate (NDSEG) Fellowships
(美国国防科学与工程研究生全额奖学金).


Andrew was the winner of the MIT ORC Best Ph.D. Student Paper Award
(麻省理工学院运筹学研究中心最佳博士论文奖)
in 2017
and INFORMS

George Nicholson Student Paper Competition
(First Place,
国际运筹学与管理科学学会博士论文竞赛第一名)
in
2017.
This is his

award winning paper
(and its

supplemental materials)
published in
Management Science.
He won the INFORMS

Pierskalla Best Paper Award
in 2021.
His papers have received five best paper awards/prizes and have been three other best paper award/prize finalists.


Andrew received the US National Science Foundation
Career Award
(2023-2028, 美国国家科学基金会杰青,
CMU News).


This is Andrew's
first paper
published in

Discrete Mathematics,
written at the age of (younger than) 21
with Professor
Charles R. Johnson,
the Class of 1961 Professor at College of William and Mary,
and Andrew's research advisor during a summer research program.


This is Andrew's
second paper
published in

Performance Evaluation,
written at the age of (younger than) 22
with Professor
Ward Whitt,
a member of US National Academy of Engineering,
and Andrew's research advisor at Columbia University.


This is Andrew's most recent

NeurIPS 2021 paper
(9122 submissions, acceptance rate < 1%)
and his featured
NeurIPS 2022 paper.


Here is a photo
of Andrew and his MIT classmates/friends
taken in Spring 2013 in front of their dorm.


Charlotte
(李恩惠),
the second child,
is currently a senior manager of partnerships and business accounts at Jiko,
an innovative financial technology company headquartered in San Francisco, CA.
She
graduated
with B.S. degree from
Columbia University
(哥伦比亚大学)
in May 2015
with a major in engineering management systems and a minor in economics
and another minor in entrepreneurship and innovation.
She was the secretary (2013-2014) and president (2014-2015) of

Columbia Women's Business Society (CWBS),
the largest pre-professional group at Columbia University.
She was an actuarial consultant in the Actuarial, Rewards & Analytics group of
Deloitte Consulting LLP,
the largest professional services firm in the world by revenue,
New York, NY, during 2015-2018;
and a business development manager  at
Credit Karma, Inc.,
San Francisco, CA, during 2018-2022.

Recent Journal Articles
(最近学术期刊论文)



Professor Keqin Li's
current research interests include
cloud computing,
fog computing and mobile edge computing,
energy-efficient computing and communication,
embedded systems and cyber-physical systems,
heterogeneous computing systems,
big data computing,
high-performance computing,
CPU-GPU hybrid and cooperative computing,
computer architectures and systems,
computer networking,
machine learning,
intelligent and soft computing.


See [ORCID]
for a more comprehensive elaboration of Professor Keqin Li's scientific contributions.

天行健,
君子以自强不息;



地势坤,
君子以厚德载物.








On November 24, 2014,
Professor Li was
notified
by J. Roberto B. de Marca, IEEE President and CEO,
that he has been elevated to
IEEE Fellow
(国际电气和电子工程师协会会士),
effective 1 January 2015, with the following citation:

for contributions to parallel and distributed computing.
During 1999-2014,
only 0.07% (7 out of 10,000) of IEEE members were elevated to the Fellow grade each year.


He is a 2017
recipient
of the
Albert Nelson Marquis Lifetime Achievement Award
(阿尔伯特·尼尔森·马奎斯终身成就奖)
for being listed in
Marquis
Who's Who in Science and Engineering
(科学与工程名人录),
Who's Who in America
(美国名人录),
Who's Who in the World
(世界名人录),
and Who's Who in American Education
(美国教育界名人录)
for more than 20 consecutive years.


He was a
Distinguished Speaker
(lecture available at

学堂在线)
in the
60th Anniversary Celebration
of the Department of Computer Science and Technology at Tsinghua University
(清华大学计算机系六十周年系庆杰出讲演者),
his alma mater,
on
May 22, 2018.
He received the Distinguished Alumnus Award
(休斯顿大学杰出校友奖)
in the 50th Anniversary Celebration
of the Computer Science Department at the University of Houston
on October 20, 2018.


He is listed in the


World's Top 2% Scientists
(世界顶尖科学家在线查询)
by 

Stanford University
and Elsevier's


Mendeley Data
(version 6)
and Scopus citation database
on October 4, 2023,
using a composite indicator that considers and combines six citation metrics
for 9,617,763 scientists and scholars who have published at least five papers.

Based on single-year (2022) impact
(2022年度科学影响力排行榜),
he is ranked #1 in the US and #2 in the world
among 9,403 scientists and researchers in his subfield - parallel and distributed computing
(并行和分布式计算领域全美第一名及全球第二名).

Based on career-long (1960-2022) impact
(终身科学影响力排行榜),
he is ranked #3 in the US and #4 in the world in his subfield
(并行和分布式计算领域全美第三名及全球第四名).



He is among the 6 only computer scientists globally and historically (as of 2022),
each has more than 140 single-authored papers and has a composite indicator greater than 4.0.
(全球论文最多及影响最大的计算机科学家)


On June 17, 2022,
Professor Li was notified by President Marja Makarow
that he has been elected to be a
Member
of
Academia Europaea
(The Academy of Europe,
欧洲人文和自然科学院院士).
During 1988-2022 (35 years),
the number of US scholars in informatics (computer science)
who earned the honor of MAE is only 37.
(欧洲科学院信息科学部美籍院士名单)


He became a
Fellow
of the Asia-Pacific Artificial Intelligence Association
(AAIA,
亚太人工智能协会会士)
in July 2022.


On November 30, 2022,
Professor Li was
notified
by Sudip Parikh, AAAS Chief Executive Officer,
that he has been elevated to the rank of
AAAS Fellow
(美国科学促进会院士),
with the following citation:


For distinguished contributions to the field of parallel and distributed computing,
particularly for parallel algorithms design, energy-efficient computing techniques development, and theoretical modeling and analytical optimization of cloud computing systems.
(美国科学促进会华裔院士名单
(1983-2023))



He received the
IEEE TCCLD Research Impact Award
(IEEE 云计算技术委员会研究影响力奖)
on December 10, 2022
from the IEEE Computer Society Technical Committee on Cloud Computing for his

significant, systematic, and sustained contributions
to modeling, analysis, and optimization of cloud computing systems.


On June 9, 2023,
it was announced that
Professor Li was the recipient of the

2023 IEEE TCSVC Research Innovation Award (RIA)
(IEEE 服务计算技术委员会研究创新奖)
of the IEEE Computer Society Technical Community on Services Computing (TCSVC)
for his 

outstanding contributions to services computing,
particularly to analytical investigation in cloud computing and combinatorial optimization in mobile edge computing.


On November 6, 2023,
Professor Li was notified
by Bala Prasanna (IEEE Region 1 Director-Elect 2022-23) that 
he has been selected as a recipient of the 2023
IEEE Region 1 (Northeastern US) 
Technological Innovation Award (Academic)
(IEEE 1 区(美国东北部)
技术创新奖(学术))
for his


extraordinary contributions to parallel and distributed computing.


He has been a Founding Fellow
of the Asia Computational Intelligence Society
(ACIS,
亚洲计算智能学会创始会士)
since November 7, 2023.


On November 30, 2023,
he was elected as a World's AI Top Scientist
(世界人工智能顶尖科学家)
and an Academician Member
(院士成员)
of the International Artificial Intelligence Industry Alliance
(AIIA).


On February 5, 2024,
it was announced
by the Department of Science and Technology of Hunan Province
that Professor Li was a recipient of the 2023 Xiaoxiang Friendship Award
(潇湘友谊奖)
for his important contributions to scientific and technological innovation in Hunan Province.


Here are his awards in China:
[2019年湖南省高等教育教学成果二等奖],
[2020年湖南省自然科学一等奖],
[2021年湖南省自然科学二等奖],
[2023年湖南省潇湘友谊奖].

(高玲),

She was a software engineer in
Konica Minolta USA
(1994-1997),
and a staff/advisory/senior software engineer in
IBM
(1997-2023).

They have three children.


Andrew
(李安迪),
the oldest, is currently
a 
BP America Assistant Professor

(BP讲座助理教授,

BP Junior Faculty Endowed Chair,
Career Development Chair)

of 
Operations Research
at the Tepper School of Business
(with 9 Nobel Laureates),
Carnegie Mellon University
(卡内基·梅隆大学).

He received his Ph.D. degree from the
Operations Research Center (ORC)
at
Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT)
(麻省理工学院)
under the supervision of Professor Vivek F. Farias.

He received his B.S. degree 
(Summa Cum Laude,
meaning "with the highest honor" in Latin and GPA top 1%,
最高荣誉生)
from
Columbia University
(哥伦比亚大学)
with a major in financial engineering and a minor in applied mathematics.
He is a
member of 
Tau Beta Pi,
and a recipient of the
Sebastian B. Littauer Award
from the Fu Foundation School of Engineering and Applied Science
in recognition of his superior achievement
and outstanding promise of scholarly and professional achievement in operations research.
He was an awardee of

National Defense Science and Engineering Graduate (NDSEG) Fellowships
(美国国防科学与工程研究生全额奖学金).


Andrew was the winner of the MIT ORC Best Ph.D. Student Paper Award
(麻省理工学院运筹学研究中心最佳博士论文奖)
in 2017
and INFORMS

George Nicholson Student Paper Competition
(First Place,
国际运筹学与管理科学学会博士论文竞赛第一名)
in
2017.
This is his

award winning paper
(and its

supplemental materials)
published in
Management Science.
He won the INFORMS

Pierskalla Best Paper Award
in 2021.
His papers have received five best paper awards/prizes and have been three other best paper award/prize finalists.


Andrew received the US National Science Foundation
Career Award
(2023-2028, 美国国家科学基金会杰青,
CMU News).


This is Andrew's
first paper
published in

Discrete Mathematics,
written at the age of (younger than) 21
with Professor
Charles R. Johnson,
the Class of 1961 Professor at College of William and Mary,
and Andrew's research advisor during a summer research program.


This is Andrew's
second paper
published in

Performance Evaluation,
written at the age of (younger than) 22
with Professor
Ward Whitt,
a member of US National Academy of Engineering,
and Andrew's research advisor at Columbia University.


This is Andrew's most recent

NeurIPS 2021 paper
(9122 submissions, acceptance rate < 1%)
and his featured
NeurIPS 2022 paper.


Here is a photo
of Andrew and his MIT classmates/friends
taken in Spring 2013 in front of their dorm.


Charlotte
(李恩惠),
the second child,
is currently a senior manager of partnerships and business accounts at Jiko,
an innovative financial technology company headquartered in San Francisco, CA.
She
graduated
with B.S. degree from
Columbia University
(哥伦比亚大学)
in May 2015
with a major in engineering management systems and a minor in economics
and another minor in entrepreneurship and innovation.
She was the secretary (2013-2014) and president (2014-2015) of

Columbia Women's Business Society (CWBS),
the largest pre-professional group at Columbia University.
She was an actuarial consultant in the Actuarial, Rewards & Analytics group of
Deloitte Consulting LLP,
the largest professional services firm in the world by revenue,
New York, NY, during 2015-2018;
and a business development manager  at
Credit Karma, Inc.,
San Francisco, CA, during 2018-2022.

during February 2014.

Research in COVID-19
(新冠病毒研究)



K. Li,
"Transmission dynamics of the global COVID-19 epidemic: analytical modeling and future prediction,"
(全球新冠病毒流行的传播动力学:
分析建模和未来预测),
DOI: 10.21203/rs.3.rs-21448/v1,
April 7, 2020.
[Research Square]
[pdf]


K. Li,
"Pooling strategy optimization for accelerating asymptomatic COVID-19 screening,"
(加速无症状新冠病毒检测的合并策略优化),
DOI: 10.21203/rs.3.rs-33986/v1,
June 9, 2020.
[Research Square]
[pdf]


Jianguo Chen, Kenli Li, Zhaolei Zhang, Keqin Li, Philip S. Yu,
"A survey on applications of artificial intelligence in fighting against COVID-19,"
(人工智能在对抗新冠病毒中的应用之综述),
arXiv:2007.02202,
4 July 2020.
[arXiv]
[pdf]


Keqin Li and Bo Yang,
"Achieving maximum speedup in multi-level acceleration for massive coronavirus testing,"
(在多级提速中实现大规模冠状病毒测试的最大加速比),
DOI: 10.21203/rs.3.rs-2679304/v1,
14 March 2023.

Recent Books
(最近学术著作)



Guoqi Xie, Gang Zeng, Renfa Li, and Keqin Li,
Scheduling Parallel Applications on Heterogeneous Distributed Systems
(异构分布式系统中的并行应用调度),
246 pp., Springer Nature Singapore Pte Ltd., 2019.

Recent Journal Articles
(最近学术期刊论文)



Professor Keqin Li's
current research interests include
cloud computing,
fog computing and mobile edge computing,
energy-efficient computing and communication,
embedded systems and cyber-physical systems,
heterogeneous computing systems,
big data computing,
high-performance computing,
CPU-GPU hybrid and cooperative computing,
computer architectures and systems,
computer networking,
machine learning,
intelligent and soft computing.


See [ORCID]
for a more comprehensive elaboration of Professor Keqin Li's scientific contributions.

天行健,
君子以自强不息;



地势坤,
君子以厚德载物.








He is among the 6 only computer scientists globally and historically (as of 2022),
each has more than 140 single-authored papers and has a composite indicator greater than 4.0.
(全球论文最多及影响最大的计算机科学家)


On June 17, 2022,
Professor Li was notified by President Marja Makarow
that he has been elected to be a
Member
of
Academia Europaea
(The Academy of Europe,
欧洲人文和自然科学院院士).
During 1988-2022 (35 years),
the number of US scholars in informatics (computer science)
who earned the honor of MAE is only 37.
(欧洲科学院信息科学部美籍院士名单)


He became a
Fellow
of the Asia-Pacific Artificial Intelligence Association
(AAIA,
亚太人工智能协会会士)
in July 2022.


On November 30, 2022,
Professor Li was
notified
by Sudip Parikh, AAAS Chief Executive Officer,
that he has been elevated to the rank of
AAAS Fellow
(美国科学促进会院士),
with the following citation:


For distinguished contributions to the field of parallel and distributed computing,
particularly for parallel algorithms design, energy-efficient computing techniques development, and theoretical modeling and analytical optimization of cloud computing systems.
(美国科学促进会华裔院士名单
(1983-2023))



He received the
IEEE TCCLD Research Impact Award
(IEEE 云计算技术委员会研究影响力奖)
on December 10, 2022
from the IEEE Computer Society Technical Committee on Cloud Computing for his

significant, systematic, and sustained contributions
to modeling, analysis, and optimization of cloud computing systems.


On June 9, 2023,
it was announced that
Professor Li was the recipient of the

2023 IEEE TCSVC Research Innovation Award (RIA)
(IEEE 服务计算技术委员会研究创新奖)
of the IEEE Computer Society Technical Community on Services Computing (TCSVC)
for his 

outstanding contributions to services computing,
particularly to analytical investigation in cloud computing and combinatorial optimization in mobile edge computing.


On November 6, 2023,
Professor Li was notified
by Bala Prasanna (IEEE Region 1 Director-Elect 2022-23) that 
he has been selected as a recipient of the 2023
IEEE Region 1 (Northeastern US) 
Technological Innovation Award (Academic)
(IEEE 1 区(美国东北部)
技术创新奖(学术))
for his


extraordinary contributions to parallel and distributed computing.


He has been a Founding Fellow
of the Asia Computational Intelligence Society
(ACIS,
亚洲计算智能学会创始会士)
since November 7, 2023.


On November 30, 2023,
he was elected as a World's AI Top Scientist
(世界人工智能顶尖科学家)
and an Academician Member
(院士成员)
of the International Artificial Intelligence Industry Alliance
(AIIA).


On February 5, 2024,
it was announced
by the Department of Science and Technology of Hunan Province
that Professor Li was a recipient of the 2023 Xiaoxiang Friendship Award
(潇湘友谊奖)
for his important contributions to scientific and technological innovation in Hunan Province.


Here are his awards in China:
[2019年湖南省高等教育教学成果二等奖],
[2020年湖南省自然科学一等奖],
[2021年湖南省自然科学二等奖],
[2023年湖南省潇湘友谊奖].


Professor Li is married with 
Ling Gao
(高玲),
a 
Tsinghua alumna.
She was a software engineer in
Konica Minolta USA
(1994-1997),
and a staff/advisory/senior software engineer in
IBM
(1997-2023).

when they are at the age of 60.


This is Ling (front, center) in her dance team performance show:
"Kite"
(风筝)
during 2019 Chinese New Year celebration,
and
"Swan Goose"
(鸿雁)
during 2024 Chinese New Year celebration.


They have three children.


Andrew
(李安迪),
the oldest, is currently
a 
BP America Assistant Professor

(BP讲座助理教授,

BP Junior Faculty Endowed Chair,
Career Development Chair)

of 
Operations Research
at the Tepper School of Business
(with 9 Nobel Laureates),
Carnegie Mellon University
(卡内基·梅隆大学).

He received his Ph.D. degree from the
Operations Research Center (ORC)
at
Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT)
(麻省理工学院)
under the supervision of Professor Vivek F. Farias.

He received his B.S. degree 
(Summa Cum Laude,
meaning "with the highest honor" in Latin and GPA top 1%,
最高荣誉生)
from
Columbia University
(哥伦比亚大学)
with a major in financial engineering and a minor in applied mathematics.
He is a
member of 
Tau Beta Pi,
and a recipient of the
Sebastian B. Littauer Award
from the Fu Foundation School of Engineering and Applied Science
in recognition of his superior achievement
and outstanding promise of scholarly and professional achievement in operations research.
He was an awardee of

National Defense Science and Engineering Graduate (NDSEG) Fellowships
(美国国防科学与工程研究生全额奖学金).


Andrew was the winner of the MIT ORC Best Ph.D. Student Paper Award
(麻省理工学院运筹学研究中心最佳博士论文奖)
in 2017
and INFORMS

George Nicholson Student Paper Competition
(First Place,
国际运筹学与管理科学学会博士论文竞赛第一名)
in
2017.
This is his

award winning paper
(and its

supplemental materials)
published in
Management Science.
He won the INFORMS

Pierskalla Best Paper Award
in 2021.
His papers have received five best paper awards/prizes and have been three other best paper award/prize finalists.


Andrew received the US National Science Foundation
Career Award
(2023-2028, 美国国家科学基金会杰青,
CMU News).


This is Andrew's
first paper
published in

Discrete Mathematics,
written at the age of (younger than) 21
with Professor
Charles R. Johnson,
the Class of 1961 Professor at College of William and Mary,
and Andrew's research advisor during a summer research program.


This is Andrew's
second paper
published in

Performance Evaluation,
written at the age of (younger than) 22
with Professor
Ward Whitt,
a member of US National Academy of Engineering,
and Andrew's research advisor at Columbia University.


This is Andrew's most recent

NeurIPS 2021 paper
(9122 submissions, acceptance rate < 1%)
and his featured
NeurIPS 2022 paper.


Here is a photo
of Andrew and his MIT classmates/friends
taken in Spring 2013 in front of their dorm.


Charlotte
(李恩惠),
the second child,
is currently a senior manager of partnerships and business accounts at Jiko,
an innovative financial technology company headquartered in San Francisco, CA.
She
graduated
with B.S. degree from
Columbia University
(哥伦比亚大学)
in May 2015
with a major in engineering management systems and a minor in economics
and another minor in entrepreneurship and innovation.
She was the secretary (2013-2014) and president (2014-2015) of

Columbia Women's Business Society (CWBS),
the largest pre-professional group at Columbia University.
She was an actuarial consultant in the Actuarial, Rewards & Analytics group of
Deloitte Consulting LLP,
the largest professional services firm in the world by revenue,
New York, NY, during 2015-2018;
and a business development manager  at
Credit Karma, Inc.,
San Francisco, CA, during 2018-2022.

during February 2014.

Recent Journal Articles
(最近学术期刊论文)



Professor Keqin Li's
current research interests include
cloud computing,
fog computing and mobile edge computing,
energy-efficient computing and communication,
embedded systems and cyber-physical systems,
heterogeneous computing systems,
big data computing,
high-performance computing,
CPU-GPU hybrid and cooperative computing,
computer architectures and systems,
computer networking,
machine learning,
intelligent and soft computing.


See [ORCID]
for a more comprehensive elaboration of Professor Keqin Li's scientific contributions.

This is Ling (front, center) in her dance team performance show:
"Kite"
(风筝)
during 2019 Chinese New Year celebration,
and
"Swan Goose"
(鸿雁)
during 2024 Chinese New Year celebration.


They have three children.


Andrew
(李安迪),
the oldest, is currently
a 
BP America Assistant Professor

(BP讲座助理教授,

BP Junior Faculty Endowed Chair,
Career Development Chair)

of 
Operations Research
at the Tepper School of Business
(with 9 Nobel Laureates),
Carnegie Mellon University
(卡内基·梅隆大学).

He received his Ph.D. degree from the
Operations Research Center (ORC)
at
Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT)
(麻省理工学院)
under the supervision of Professor Vivek F. Farias.

He received his B.S. degree 
(Summa Cum Laude,
meaning "with the highest honor" in Latin and GPA top 1%,
最高荣誉生)
from
Columbia University
(哥伦比亚大学)
with a major in financial engineering and a minor in applied mathematics.
He is a
member of 
Tau Beta Pi,
and a recipient of the
Sebastian B. Littauer Award
from the Fu Foundation School of Engineering and Applied Science
in recognition of his superior achievement
and outstanding promise of scholarly and professional achievement in operations research.
He was an awardee of

National Defense Science and Engineering Graduate (NDSEG) Fellowships
(美国国防科学与工程研究生全额奖学金).


Andrew was the winner of the MIT ORC Best Ph.D. Student Paper Award
(麻省理工学院运筹学研究中心最佳博士论文奖)
in 2017
and INFORMS

George Nicholson Student Paper Competition
(First Place,
国际运筹学与管理科学学会博士论文竞赛第一名)
in
2017.
This is his

award winning paper
(and its

supplemental materials)
published in
Management Science.
He won the INFORMS

Pierskalla Best Paper Award
in 2021.
His papers have received five best paper awards/prizes and have been three other best paper award/prize finalists.


Andrew received the US National Science Foundation
Career Award
(2023-2028, 美国国家科学基金会杰青,
CMU News).


This is Andrew's
first paper
published in

Discrete Mathematics,
written at the age of (younger than) 21
with Professor
Charles R. Johnson,
the Class of 1961 Professor at College of William and Mary,
and Andrew's research advisor during a summer research program.


This is Andrew's
second paper
published in

Performance Evaluation,
written at the age of (younger than) 22
with Professor
Ward Whitt,
a member of US National Academy of Engineering,
and Andrew's research advisor at Columbia University.


This is Andrew's most recent

NeurIPS 2021 paper
(9122 submissions, acceptance rate < 1%)
and his featured
NeurIPS 2022 paper.


Here is a photo
of Andrew and his MIT classmates/friends
taken in Spring 2013 in front of their dorm.


Charlotte
(李恩惠),
the second child,
is currently a senior manager of partnerships and business accounts at Jiko,
an innovative financial technology company headquartered in San Francisco, CA.
She
graduated
with B.S. degree from
Columbia University
(哥伦比亚大学)
in May 2015
with a major in engineering management systems and a minor in economics
and another minor in entrepreneurship and innovation.
She was the secretary (2013-2014) and president (2014-2015) of

Columbia Women's Business Society (CWBS),
the largest pre-professional group at Columbia University.
She was an actuarial consultant in the Actuarial, Rewards & Analytics group of
Deloitte Consulting LLP,
the largest professional services firm in the world by revenue,
New York, NY, during 2015-2018;
and a business development manager  at
Credit Karma, Inc.,
San Francisco, CA, during 2018-2022.

during February 2014.

Recent Journal Articles
(最近学术期刊论文)



Professor Keqin Li's
current research interests include
cloud computing,
fog computing and mobile edge computing,
energy-efficient computing and communication,
embedded systems and cyber-physical systems,
heterogeneous computing systems,
big data computing,
high-performance computing,
CPU-GPU hybrid and cooperative computing,
computer architectures and systems,
computer networking,
machine learning,
intelligent and soft computing.


See [ORCID]
for a more comprehensive elaboration of Professor Keqin Li's scientific contributions.

This is Ling (front, center) in her dance team performance show:
"Kite"
(风筝)
during 2019 Chinese New Year celebration,
and
"Swan Goose"
(鸿雁)
during 2024 Chinese New Year celebration.


They have three children.


Andrew
(李安迪),
the oldest, is currently
a 
BP America Assistant Professor

(BP讲座助理教授,

BP Junior Faculty Endowed Chair,
Career Development Chair)

of 
Operations Research
at the Tepper School of Business
(with 9 Nobel Laureates),
Carnegie Mellon University
(卡内基·梅隆大学).

He received his Ph.D. degree from the
Operations Research Center (ORC)
at
Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT)
(麻省理工学院)
under the supervision of Professor Vivek F. Farias.

He received his B.S. degree 
(Summa Cum Laude,
meaning "with the highest honor" in Latin and GPA top 1%,
最高荣誉生)
from
Columbia University
(哥伦比亚大学)
with a major in financial engineering and a minor in applied mathematics.
He is a
member of 
Tau Beta Pi,
and a recipient of the
Sebastian B. Littauer Award
from the Fu Foundation School of Engineering and Applied Science
in recognition of his superior achievement
and outstanding promise of scholarly and professional achievement in operations research.
He was an awardee of

National Defense Science and Engineering Graduate (NDSEG) Fellowships
(美国国防科学与工程研究生全额奖学金).


Andrew was the winner of the MIT ORC Best Ph.D. Student Paper Award
(麻省理工学院运筹学研究中心最佳博士论文奖)
in 2017
and INFORMS

George Nicholson Student Paper Competition
(First Place,
国际运筹学与管理科学学会博士论文竞赛第一名)
in
2017.
This is his

award winning paper
(and its

supplemental materials)
published in
Management Science.
He won the INFORMS

Pierskalla Best Paper Award
in 2021.
His papers have received five best paper awards/prizes and have been three other best paper award/prize finalists.


Andrew received the US National Science Foundation
Career Award
(2023-2028, 美国国家科学基金会杰青,
CMU News).


This is Andrew's
first paper
published in

Discrete Mathematics,
written at the age of (younger than) 21
with Professor
Charles R. Johnson,
the Class of 1961 Professor at College of William and Mary,
and Andrew's research advisor during a summer research program.


This is Andrew's
second paper
published in

Performance Evaluation,
written at the age of (younger than) 22
with Professor
Ward Whitt,
a member of US National Academy of Engineering,
and Andrew's research advisor at Columbia University.


This is Andrew's most recent

NeurIPS 2021 paper
(9122 submissions, acceptance rate < 1%)
and his featured
NeurIPS 2022 paper.


Here is a photo
of Andrew and his MIT classmates/friends
taken in Spring 2013 in front of their dorm.


Charlotte
(李恩惠),
the second child,
is currently a senior manager of partnerships and business accounts at Jiko,
an innovative financial technology company headquartered in San Francisco, CA.
She
graduated
with B.S. degree from
Columbia University
(哥伦比亚大学)
in May 2015
with a major in engineering management systems and a minor in economics
and another minor in entrepreneurship and innovation.
She was the secretary (2013-2014) and president (2014-2015) of

Columbia Women's Business Society (CWBS),
the largest pre-professional group at Columbia University.
She was an actuarial consultant in the Actuarial, Rewards & Analytics group of
Deloitte Consulting LLP,
the largest professional services firm in the world by revenue,
New York, NY, during 2015-2018;
and a business development manager  at
Credit Karma, Inc.,
San Francisco, CA, during 2018-2022.

Research in COVID-19
(新冠病毒研究)



K. Li,
"Transmission dynamics of the global COVID-19 epidemic: analytical modeling and future prediction,"
(全球新冠病毒流行的传播动力学:

April 7, 2020.

Recent Journal Articles
(最近学术期刊论文)



Professor Keqin Li's
current research interests include
cloud computing,
fog computing and mobile edge computing,
energy-efficient computing and communication,
embedded systems and cyber-physical systems,
heterogeneous computing systems,
big data computing,
high-performance computing,
CPU-GPU hybrid and cooperative computing,
computer architectures and systems,
computer networking,
machine learning,
intelligent and soft computing.


See [ORCID]
for a more comprehensive elaboration of Professor Keqin Li's scientific contributions.

天行健,
君子以自强不息;



地势坤,
君子以厚德载物.








This is Ling (front, center) in her dance team performance show:
"Kite"
(风筝)
during 2019 Chinese New Year celebration,
and
"Swan Goose"
(鸿雁)
during 2024 Chinese New Year celebration.


They have three children.


Andrew
(李安迪),
the oldest, is currently
a 
BP America Assistant Professor

(BP讲座助理教授,

BP Junior Faculty Endowed Chair,
Career Development Chair)

of 
Operations Research
at the Tepper School of Business
(with 9 Nobel Laureates),
Carnegie Mellon University
(卡内基·梅隆大学).

He received his Ph.D. degree from the
Operations Research Center (ORC)
at
Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT)
(麻省理工学院)
under the supervision of Professor Vivek F. Farias.

He received his B.S. degree 
(Summa Cum Laude,
meaning "with the highest honor" in Latin and GPA top 1%,
最高荣誉生)
from
Columbia University
(哥伦比亚大学)
with a major in financial engineering and a minor in applied mathematics.
He is a
member of 
Tau Beta Pi,
and a recipient of the
Sebastian B. Littauer Award
from the Fu Foundation School of Engineering and Applied Science
in recognition of his superior achievement
and outstanding promise of scholarly and professional achievement in operations research.
He was an awardee of

National Defense Science and Engineering Graduate (NDSEG) Fellowships
(美国国防科学与工程研究生全额奖学金).


Andrew was the winner of the MIT ORC Best Ph.D. Student Paper Award
(麻省理工学院运筹学研究中心最佳博士论文奖)
in 2017
and INFORMS

George Nicholson Student Paper Competition
(First Place,
国际运筹学与管理科学学会博士论文竞赛第一名)
in
2017.
This is his

award winning paper
(and its

supplemental materials)
published in
Management Science.
He won the INFORMS

Pierskalla Best Paper Award
in 2021.
His papers have received five best paper awards/prizes and have been three other best paper award/prize finalists.


Andrew received the US National Science Foundation
Career Award
(2023-2028, 美国国家科学基金会杰青,
CMU News).


This is Andrew's
first paper
published in

Discrete Mathematics,
written at the age of (younger than) 21
with Professor
Charles R. Johnson,
the Class of 1961 Professor at College of William and Mary,
and Andrew's research advisor during a summer research program.


This is Andrew's
second paper
published in

Performance Evaluation,
written at the age of (younger than) 22
with Professor
Ward Whitt,
a member of US National Academy of Engineering,
and Andrew's research advisor at Columbia University.


This is Andrew's most recent

NeurIPS 2021 paper
(9122 submissions, acceptance rate < 1%)
and his featured
NeurIPS 2022 paper.


Here is a photo
of Andrew and his MIT classmates/friends
taken in Spring 2013 in front of their dorm.


Charlotte
(李恩惠),
the second child,
is currently a senior manager of partnerships and business accounts at Jiko,
an innovative financial technology company headquartered in San Francisco, CA.
She
graduated
with B.S. degree from
Columbia University
(哥伦比亚大学)
in May 2015
with a major in engineering management systems and a minor in economics
and another minor in entrepreneurship and innovation.
She was the secretary (2013-2014) and president (2014-2015) of

Columbia Women's Business Society (CWBS),
the largest pre-professional group at Columbia University.
She was an actuarial consultant in the Actuarial, Rewards & Analytics group of
Deloitte Consulting LLP,
the largest professional services firm in the world by revenue,
New York, NY, during 2015-2018;
and a business development manager  at
Credit Karma, Inc.,
San Francisco, CA, during 2018-2022.


Here is Charlotte in the Columbia Lunar Gala Fashion Show
during February 2014.

Enjoy Charlotte's recent piano solo:
"Fantaisie-Impromptu in C# Minor Op. 66"
by Frédéric Chopin
(肖邦的升C小调幻想即兴曲).


Christina
(李淑惠),
the youngest,
is a systems developer of Application Development at GNC Holdings LLC
(General Nutrition Corporation,
健安喜),
Pittsburgh, PA.
She
graduated
with B.S. degree from the
College of Engineering
at
Cornell University
(康奈尔大学)
in May 2021,
with a major in
computer science
and a minor in music.
She was in the Original Cornell Syncopators.
This
is Christina with Dr.
Martha Elizabeth Pollack,
the President of Cornell University in the Fall of 2017.
This
is again Christina with the President and the Jazz band in the Fall of 2019.

"Let It Defy" - A Menzel Medley
(arranged by Christina Li from
"Defying Gravity" by Stephen Schwartz and "Let It Go" by Robert Lopez and Kristen Anderson-Lopez),
and
"An American in Paris"
(composed by George Gershwin and arranged by William Daly).

Recent Journal Articles
(最近学术期刊论文)



Professor Keqin Li's
current research interests include
cloud computing,
fog computing and mobile edge computing,
energy-efficient computing and communication,
embedded systems and cyber-physical systems,
heterogeneous computing systems,
big data computing,
high-performance computing,
CPU-GPU hybrid and cooperative computing,
computer architectures and systems,
computer networking,
machine learning,
intelligent and soft computing.


See [ORCID]
for a more comprehensive elaboration of Professor Keqin Li's scientific contributions.

天行健,
君子以自强不息;



地势坤,
君子以厚德载物.








They have three children.


Andrew
(李安迪),
the oldest, is currently
a 
BP America Assistant Professor

(BP讲座助理教授,

BP Junior Faculty Endowed Chair,
Career Development Chair)

of 
Operations Research
at the Tepper School of Business
(with 9 Nobel Laureates),
Carnegie Mellon University
(卡内基·梅隆大学).

He received his Ph.D. degree from the
Operations Research Center (ORC)
at
Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT)
(麻省理工学院)
under the supervision of Professor Vivek F. Farias.

He received his B.S. degree 
(Summa Cum Laude,
meaning "with the highest honor" in Latin and GPA top 1%,
最高荣誉生)
from
Columbia University
(哥伦比亚大学)
with a major in financial engineering and a minor in applied mathematics.
He is a
member of 
Tau Beta Pi,
and a recipient of the
Sebastian B. Littauer Award
from the Fu Foundation School of Engineering and Applied Science
in recognition of his superior achievement
and outstanding promise of scholarly and professional achievement in operations research.
He was an awardee of

National Defense Science and Engineering Graduate (NDSEG) Fellowships
(美国国防科学与工程研究生全额奖学金).


Andrew was the winner of the MIT ORC Best Ph.D. Student Paper Award
(麻省理工学院运筹学研究中心最佳博士论文奖)
in 2017
and INFORMS

George Nicholson Student Paper Competition
(First Place,
国际运筹学与管理科学学会博士论文竞赛第一名)
in
2017.
This is his

award winning paper
(and its

supplemental materials)
published in
Management Science.
He won the INFORMS

Pierskalla Best Paper Award
in 2021.
His papers have received five best paper awards/prizes and have been three other best paper award/prize finalists.


Andrew received the US National Science Foundation
Career Award
(2023-2028, 美国国家科学基金会杰青,
CMU News).


This is Andrew's
first paper
published in

Discrete Mathematics,
written at the age of (younger than) 21
with Professor
Charles R. Johnson,
the Class of 1961 Professor at College of William and Mary,
and Andrew's research advisor during a summer research program.


This is Andrew's
second paper
published in

Performance Evaluation,
written at the age of (younger than) 22
with Professor
Ward Whitt,
a member of US National Academy of Engineering,
and Andrew's research advisor at Columbia University.


This is Andrew's most recent

NeurIPS 2021 paper
(9122 submissions, acceptance rate < 1%)
and his featured
NeurIPS 2022 paper.


Here is a photo
of Andrew and his MIT classmates/friends
taken in Spring 2013 in front of their dorm.


Charlotte
(李恩惠),
the second child,
is currently a senior manager of partnerships and business accounts at Jiko,
an innovative financial technology company headquartered in San Francisco, CA.
She
graduated
with B.S. degree from
Columbia University
(哥伦比亚大学)
in May 2015
with a major in engineering management systems and a minor in economics
and another minor in entrepreneurship and innovation.
She was the secretary (2013-2014) and president (2014-2015) of

Columbia Women's Business Society (CWBS),
the largest pre-professional group at Columbia University.
She was an actuarial consultant in the Actuarial, Rewards & Analytics group of
Deloitte Consulting LLP,
the largest professional services firm in the world by revenue,
New York, NY, during 2015-2018;
and a business development manager  at
Credit Karma, Inc.,
San Francisco, CA, during 2018-2022.

during February 2014.

Recent Journal Articles
(最近学术期刊论文)



Professor Keqin Li's
current research interests include
cloud computing,
fog computing and mobile edge computing,
energy-efficient computing and communication,
embedded systems and cyber-physical systems,
heterogeneous computing systems,
big data computing,
high-performance computing,
CPU-GPU hybrid and cooperative computing,
computer architectures and systems,
computer networking,
machine learning,
intelligent and soft computing.


See [ORCID]
for a more comprehensive elaboration of Professor Keqin Li's scientific contributions.

天行健,
君子以自强不息;



地势坤,
君子以厚德载物.








Andrew
(李安迪),
the oldest, is currently
a 
BP America Assistant Professor

(BP讲座助理教授,

BP Junior Faculty Endowed Chair,
Career Development Chair)

of 
Operations Research
at the Tepper School of Business
(with 9 Nobel Laureates),
Carnegie Mellon University
(卡内基·梅隆大学).

He received his Ph.D. degree from the
Operations Research Center (ORC)
at
Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT)
(麻省理工学院)
under the supervision of Professor Vivek F. Farias.

He received his B.S. degree 
(Summa Cum Laude,
meaning "with the highest honor" in Latin and GPA top 1%,
最高荣誉生)
from
Columbia University
(哥伦比亚大学)
with a major in financial engineering and a minor in applied mathematics.
He is a
member of 
Tau Beta Pi,
and a recipient of the
Sebastian B. Littauer Award
from the Fu Foundation School of Engineering and Applied Science
in recognition of his superior achievement
and outstanding promise of scholarly and professional achievement in operations research.
He was an awardee of

National Defense Science and Engineering Graduate (NDSEG) Fellowships
(美国国防科学与工程研究生全额奖学金).


Andrew was the winner of the MIT ORC Best Ph.D. Student Paper Award
(麻省理工学院运筹学研究中心最佳博士论文奖)
in 2017
and INFORMS

George Nicholson Student Paper Competition
(First Place,
国际运筹学与管理科学学会博士论文竞赛第一名)
in
2017.
This is his

award winning paper
(and its

supplemental materials)
published in
Management Science.
He won the INFORMS

Pierskalla Best Paper Award
in 2021.
His papers have received five best paper awards/prizes and have been three other best paper award/prize finalists.


Andrew received the US National Science Foundation
Career Award
(2023-2028, 美国国家科学基金会杰青,
CMU News).


This is Andrew's
first paper
published in

Discrete Mathematics,
written at the age of (younger than) 21
with Professor
Charles R. Johnson,
the Class of 1961 Professor at College of William and Mary,
and Andrew's research advisor during a summer research program.


This is Andrew's
second paper
published in

Performance Evaluation,
written at the age of (younger than) 22
with Professor
Ward Whitt,
a member of US National Academy of Engineering,
and Andrew's research advisor at Columbia University.


This is Andrew's most recent

NeurIPS 2021 paper
(9122 submissions, acceptance rate < 1%)
and his featured
NeurIPS 2022 paper.


Here is a photo
of Andrew and his MIT classmates/friends
taken in Spring 2013 in front of their dorm.


Charlotte
(李恩惠),
the second child,
is currently a senior manager of partnerships and business accounts at Jiko,
an innovative financial technology company headquartered in San Francisco, CA.
She
graduated
with B.S. degree from
Columbia University
(哥伦比亚大学)
in May 2015
with a major in engineering management systems and a minor in economics
and another minor in entrepreneurship and innovation.
She was the secretary (2013-2014) and president (2014-2015) of

Columbia Women's Business Society (CWBS),
the largest pre-professional group at Columbia University.
She was an actuarial consultant in the Actuarial, Rewards & Analytics group of
Deloitte Consulting LLP,
the largest professional services firm in the world by revenue,
New York, NY, during 2015-2018;
and a business development manager  at
Credit Karma, Inc.,
San Francisco, CA, during 2018-2022.

during February 2014.

Recent Journal Articles
(最近学术期刊论文)



Professor Keqin Li's
current research interests include
cloud computing,
fog computing and mobile edge computing,
energy-efficient computing and communication,
embedded systems and cyber-physical systems,
heterogeneous computing systems,
big data computing,
high-performance computing,
CPU-GPU hybrid and cooperative computing,
computer architectures and systems,
computer networking,
machine learning,
intelligent and soft computing.


See [ORCID]
for a more comprehensive elaboration of Professor Keqin Li's scientific contributions.

天行健,
君子以自强不息;



地势坤,
君子以厚德载物.








Andrew was the winner of the MIT ORC Best Ph.D. Student Paper Award
(麻省理工学院运筹学研究中心最佳博士论文奖)
in 2017
and INFORMS

George Nicholson Student Paper Competition
(First Place,
国际运筹学与管理科学学会博士论文竞赛第一名)
in
2017.
This is his

award winning paper
(and its

supplemental materials)
published in
Management Science.
He won the INFORMS

Pierskalla Best Paper Award
in 2021.
His papers have received five best paper awards/prizes and have been three other best paper award/prize finalists.


Andrew received the US National Science Foundation
Career Award
(2023-2028, 美国国家科学基金会杰青,
CMU News).


This is Andrew's
first paper
published in

Discrete Mathematics,
written at the age of (younger than) 21
with Professor
Charles R. Johnson,
the Class of 1961 Professor at College of William and Mary,
and Andrew's research advisor during a summer research program.


This is Andrew's
second paper
published in

Performance Evaluation,
written at the age of (younger than) 22
with Professor
Ward Whitt,
a member of US National Academy of Engineering,
and Andrew's research advisor at Columbia University.


This is Andrew's most recent

NeurIPS 2021 paper
(9122 submissions, acceptance rate < 1%)
and his featured
NeurIPS 2022 paper.


Here is a photo
of Andrew and his MIT classmates/friends
taken in Spring 2013 in front of their dorm.


Charlotte
(李恩惠),
the second child,
is currently a senior manager of partnerships and business accounts at Jiko,
an innovative financial technology company headquartered in San Francisco, CA.
She
graduated
with B.S. degree from
Columbia University
(哥伦比亚大学)
in May 2015
with a major in engineering management systems and a minor in economics
and another minor in entrepreneurship and innovation.
She was the secretary (2013-2014) and president (2014-2015) of

Columbia Women's Business Society (CWBS),
the largest pre-professional group at Columbia University.
She was an actuarial consultant in the Actuarial, Rewards & Analytics group of
Deloitte Consulting LLP,
the largest professional services firm in the world by revenue,
New York, NY, during 2015-2018;
and a business development manager  at
Credit Karma, Inc.,
San Francisco, CA, during 2018-2022.


Here is Charlotte in the Columbia Lunar Gala Fashion Show
during February 2014.

Recent Journal Articles
(最近学术期刊论文)



Professor Keqin Li's
current research interests include
cloud computing,
fog computing and mobile edge computing,
energy-efficient computing and communication,
embedded systems and cyber-physical systems,
heterogeneous computing systems,
big data computing,
high-performance computing,
CPU-GPU hybrid and cooperative computing,
computer architectures and systems,
computer networking,
machine learning,
intelligent and soft computing.


See [ORCID]
for a more comprehensive elaboration of Professor Keqin Li's scientific contributions.

天行健,
君子以自强不息;

君子以厚德载物.








Andrew received the US National Science Foundation
Career Award
(2023-2028, 美国国家科学基金会杰青,
CMU News).


This is Andrew's
first paper
published in

Discrete Mathematics,
written at the age of (younger than) 21
with Professor
Charles R. Johnson,
the Class of 1961 Professor at College of William and Mary,
and Andrew's research advisor during a summer research program.


This is Andrew's
second paper
published in

Performance Evaluation,
written at the age of (younger than) 22
with Professor
Ward Whitt,
a member of US National Academy of Engineering,
and Andrew's research advisor at Columbia University.


This is Andrew's most recent

NeurIPS 2021 paper
(9122 submissions, acceptance rate < 1%)
and his featured
NeurIPS 2022 paper.


Here is a photo
of Andrew and his MIT classmates/friends
taken in Spring 2013 in front of their dorm.


Charlotte
(李恩惠),
the second child,
is currently a senior manager of partnerships and business accounts at Jiko,
an innovative financial technology company headquartered in San Francisco, CA.
She
graduated
with B.S. degree from
Columbia University
(哥伦比亚大学)
in May 2015
with a major in engineering management systems and a minor in economics
and another minor in entrepreneurship and innovation.
She was the secretary (2013-2014) and president (2014-2015) of

Columbia Women's Business Society (CWBS),
the largest pre-professional group at Columbia University.
She was an actuarial consultant in the Actuarial, Rewards & Analytics group of
Deloitte Consulting LLP,
the largest professional services firm in the world by revenue,
New York, NY, during 2015-2018;
and a business development manager  at
Credit Karma, Inc.,
San Francisco, CA, during 2018-2022.


Here is Charlotte in the Columbia Lunar Gala Fashion Show
during February 2014.

Recent Journal Articles
(最近学术期刊论文)



Professor Keqin Li's
current research interests include
cloud computing,
fog computing and mobile edge computing,
energy-efficient computing and communication,
embedded systems and cyber-physical systems,
heterogeneous computing systems,
big data computing,
high-performance computing,
CPU-GPU hybrid and cooperative computing,
computer architectures and systems,
computer networking,
machine learning,
intelligent and soft computing.


See [ORCID]
for a more comprehensive elaboration of Professor Keqin Li's scientific contributions.

君子以自强不息;

君子以厚德载物.








This is Andrew's
first paper
published in

Discrete Mathematics,
written at the age of (younger than) 21
with Professor
Charles R. Johnson,
the Class of 1961 Professor at College of William and Mary,
and Andrew's research advisor during a summer research program.


This is Andrew's
second paper
published in

Performance Evaluation,
written at the age of (younger than) 22
with Professor
Ward Whitt,
a member of US National Academy of Engineering,
and Andrew's research advisor at Columbia University.


This is Andrew's most recent

NeurIPS 2021 paper
(9122 submissions, acceptance rate < 1%)
and his featured
NeurIPS 2022 paper.


Here is a photo
of Andrew and his MIT classmates/friends
taken in Spring 2013 in front of their dorm.


Charlotte
(李恩惠),
the second child,
is currently a senior manager of partnerships and business accounts at Jiko,
an innovative financial technology company headquartered in San Francisco, CA.
She
graduated
with B.S. degree from
Columbia University
(哥伦比亚大学)
in May 2015
with a major in engineering management systems and a minor in economics
and another minor in entrepreneurship and innovation.
She was the secretary (2013-2014) and president (2014-2015) of

Columbia Women's Business Society (CWBS),
the largest pre-professional group at Columbia University.
She was an actuarial consultant in the Actuarial, Rewards & Analytics group of
Deloitte Consulting LLP,
the largest professional services firm in the world by revenue,
New York, NY, during 2015-2018;
and a business development manager  at
Credit Karma, Inc.,
San Francisco, CA, during 2018-2022.


Here is Charlotte in the Columbia Lunar Gala Fashion Show
during February 2014.

Recent Journal Articles
(最近学术期刊论文)



Professor Keqin Li's
current research interests include
cloud computing,
fog computing and mobile edge computing,
energy-efficient computing and communication,
embedded systems and cyber-physical systems,
heterogeneous computing systems,
big data computing,
high-performance computing,
CPU-GPU hybrid and cooperative computing,
computer architectures and systems,
computer networking,
machine learning,
intelligent and soft computing.


See [ORCID]
for a more comprehensive elaboration of Professor Keqin Li's scientific contributions.

This is Andrew's
second paper
published in

Performance Evaluation,
written at the age of (younger than) 22
with Professor
Ward Whitt,
a member of US National Academy of Engineering,
and Andrew's research advisor at Columbia University.


This is Andrew's most recent

NeurIPS 2021 paper
(9122 submissions, acceptance rate < 1%)
and his featured
NeurIPS 2022 paper.


Here is a photo
of Andrew and his MIT classmates/friends
taken in Spring 2013 in front of their dorm.


Charlotte
(李恩惠),
the second child,
is currently a senior manager of partnerships and business accounts at Jiko,
an innovative financial technology company headquartered in San Francisco, CA.
She
graduated
with B.S. degree from
Columbia University
(哥伦比亚大学)
in May 2015
with a major in engineering management systems and a minor in economics
and another minor in entrepreneurship and innovation.
She was the secretary (2013-2014) and president (2014-2015) of

Columbia Women's Business Society (CWBS),
the largest pre-professional group at Columbia University.
She was an actuarial consultant in the Actuarial, Rewards & Analytics group of
Deloitte Consulting LLP,
the largest professional services firm in the world by revenue,
New York, NY, during 2015-2018;
and a business development manager  at
Credit Karma, Inc.,
San Francisco, CA, during 2018-2022.


Here is Charlotte in the Columbia Lunar Gala Fashion Show
during February 2014.

Recent Journal Articles
(最近学术期刊论文)



Professor Keqin Li's
current research interests include
cloud computing,
fog computing and mobile edge computing,
energy-efficient computing and communication,
embedded systems and cyber-physical systems,
heterogeneous computing systems,
big data computing,
high-performance computing,
CPU-GPU hybrid and cooperative computing,
computer architectures and systems,
computer networking,
machine learning,
intelligent and soft computing.


See [ORCID]
for a more comprehensive elaboration of Professor Keqin Li's scientific contributions.

This is Andrew's most recent

NeurIPS 2021 paper
(9122 submissions, acceptance rate < 1%)
and his featured
NeurIPS 2022 paper.


Here is a photo
of Andrew and his MIT classmates/friends
taken in Spring 2013 in front of their dorm.


Charlotte
(李恩惠),
the second child,
is currently a senior manager of partnerships and business accounts at Jiko,
an innovative financial technology company headquartered in San Francisco, CA.
She
graduated
with B.S. degree from
Columbia University
(哥伦比亚大学)
in May 2015
with a major in engineering management systems and a minor in economics
and another minor in entrepreneurship and innovation.
She was the secretary (2013-2014) and president (2014-2015) of

Columbia Women's Business Society (CWBS),
the largest pre-professional group at Columbia University.
She was an actuarial consultant in the Actuarial, Rewards & Analytics group of
Deloitte Consulting LLP,
the largest professional services firm in the world by revenue,
New York, NY, during 2015-2018;
and a business development manager  at
Credit Karma, Inc.,
San Francisco, CA, during 2018-2022.


Here is Charlotte in the Columbia Lunar Gala Fashion Show
during February 2014.

Recent Journal Articles
(最近学术期刊论文)



Professor Keqin Li's
current research interests include
cloud computing,
fog computing and mobile edge computing,
energy-efficient computing and communication,
embedded systems and cyber-physical systems,
heterogeneous computing systems,
big data computing,
high-performance computing,
CPU-GPU hybrid and cooperative computing,
computer architectures and systems,
computer networking,
machine learning,
intelligent and soft computing.


See [ORCID]
for a more comprehensive elaboration of Professor Keqin Li's scientific contributions.

Here is a photo
of Andrew and his MIT classmates/friends
taken in Spring 2013 in front of their dorm.


Charlotte
(李恩惠),
the second child,
is currently a senior manager of partnerships and business accounts at Jiko,
an innovative financial technology company headquartered in San Francisco, CA.
She
graduated
with B.S. degree from
Columbia University
(哥伦比亚大学)
in May 2015
with a major in engineering management systems and a minor in economics
and another minor in entrepreneurship and innovation.
She was the secretary (2013-2014) and president (2014-2015) of

Columbia Women's Business Society (CWBS),
the largest pre-professional group at Columbia University.
She was an actuarial consultant in the Actuarial, Rewards & Analytics group of
Deloitte Consulting LLP,
the largest professional services firm in the world by revenue,
New York, NY, during 2015-2018;
and a business development manager  at
Credit Karma, Inc.,
San Francisco, CA, during 2018-2022.


Here is Charlotte in the Columbia Lunar Gala Fashion Show
during February 2014.

Recent Journal Articles
(最近学术期刊论文)



Professor Keqin Li's
current research interests include
cloud computing,
fog computing and mobile edge computing,
energy-efficient computing and communication,
embedded systems and cyber-physical systems,
heterogeneous computing systems,
big data computing,
high-performance computing,
CPU-GPU hybrid and cooperative computing,
computer architectures and systems,
computer networking,
machine learning,
intelligent and soft computing.


See [ORCID]
for a more comprehensive elaboration of Professor Keqin Li's scientific contributions.

天行健,
君子以自强不息;



地势坤,
君子以厚德载物.








Charlotte
(李恩惠),
the second child,
is currently a senior manager of partnerships and business accounts at Jiko,
an innovative financial technology company headquartered in San Francisco, CA.
She
graduated
with B.S. degree from
Columbia University
(哥伦比亚大学)
in May 2015
with a major in engineering management systems and a minor in economics
and another minor in entrepreneurship and innovation.
She was the secretary (2013-2014) and president (2014-2015) of

Columbia Women's Business Society (CWBS),
the largest pre-professional group at Columbia University.
She was an actuarial consultant in the Actuarial, Rewards & Analytics group of
Deloitte Consulting LLP,
the largest professional services firm in the world by revenue,
New York, NY, during 2015-2018;
and a business development manager  at
Credit Karma, Inc.,
San Francisco, CA, during 2018-2022.


Here is Charlotte in the Columbia Lunar Gala Fashion Show
during February 2014.

by Frédéric Chopin

Christina
(李淑惠),
the youngest,
is a systems developer of Application Development at GNC Holdings LLC
(General Nutrition Corporation,
健安喜),
Pittsburgh, PA.
She
graduated
with B.S. degree from the
College of Engineering
at
Cornell University
(康奈尔大学)
in May 2021,
with a major in
computer science
and a minor in music.
She was in the Original Cornell Syncopators.

is Christina with Dr.
Martha Elizabeth Pollack,
the President of Cornell University in the Fall of 2017.

is again Christina with the President and the Jazz band in the Fall of 2019.

and

Recent Journal Articles
(最近学术期刊论文)



Professor Keqin Li's
current research interests include
cloud computing,
fog computing and mobile edge computing,
energy-efficient computing and communication,
embedded systems and cyber-physical systems,
heterogeneous computing systems,
big data computing,
high-performance computing,
CPU-GPU hybrid and cooperative computing,
computer architectures and systems,
computer networking,
machine learning,
intelligent and soft computing.


See [ORCID]
for a more comprehensive elaboration of Professor Keqin Li's scientific contributions.

Enjoy Charlotte's recent piano solo:
"Fantaisie-Impromptu in C# Minor Op. 66"
by Frédéric Chopin
(肖邦的升C小调幻想即兴曲).


Christina
(李淑惠),
the youngest,
is a systems developer of Application Development at GNC Holdings LLC
(General Nutrition Corporation,
健安喜),
Pittsburgh, PA.
She
graduated
with B.S. degree from the
College of Engineering
at
Cornell University
(康奈尔大学)
in May 2021,
with a major in
computer science
and a minor in music.
She was in the Original Cornell Syncopators.
This
is Christina with Dr.
Martha Elizabeth Pollack,
the President of Cornell University in the Fall of 2017.
This
is again Christina with the President and the Jazz band in the Fall of 2019.


Enjoy Christina's piano solo played when she was in high school:
"Let It Defy" - A Menzel Medley
(arranged by Christina Li from
"Defying Gravity" by Stephen Schwartz and "Let It Go" by Robert Lopez and Kristen Anderson-Lopez),
and
"An American in Paris"
(composed by George Gershwin and arranged by William Daly).

Recent Journal Articles
(最近学术期刊论文)



Professor Keqin Li's
current research interests include
cloud computing,
fog computing and mobile edge computing,
energy-efficient computing and communication,
embedded systems and cyber-physical systems,
heterogeneous computing systems,
big data computing,
high-performance computing,
CPU-GPU hybrid and cooperative computing,
computer architectures and systems,
computer networking,
machine learning,
intelligent and soft computing.


See [ORCID]
for a more comprehensive elaboration of Professor Keqin Li's scientific contributions.

Christina
(李淑惠),
the youngest,
is a systems developer of Application Development at GNC Holdings LLC
(General Nutrition Corporation,
健安喜),
Pittsburgh, PA.
She
graduated
with B.S. degree from the
College of Engineering
at
Cornell University
(康奈尔大学)
in May 2021,
with a major in
computer science
and a minor in music.
She was in the Original Cornell Syncopators.
This
is Christina with Dr.
Martha Elizabeth Pollack,
the President of Cornell University in the Fall of 2017.
This
is again Christina with the President and the Jazz band in the Fall of 2019.


Enjoy Christina's piano solo played when she was in high school:
"Let It Defy" - A Menzel Medley
(arranged by Christina Li from
"Defying Gravity" by Stephen Schwartz and "Let It Go" by Robert Lopez and Kristen Anderson-Lopez),
and
"An American in Paris"
(composed by George Gershwin and arranged by William Daly).

Recent Journal Articles
(最近学术期刊论文)



Professor Keqin Li's
current research interests include
cloud computing,
fog computing and mobile edge computing,
energy-efficient computing and communication,
embedded systems and cyber-physical systems,
heterogeneous computing systems,
big data computing,
high-performance computing,
CPU-GPU hybrid and cooperative computing,
computer architectures and systems,
computer networking,
machine learning,
intelligent and soft computing.


See [ORCID]
for a more comprehensive elaboration of Professor Keqin Li's scientific contributions.

Best Paper Awards
(最佳论文奖)



Xiongren Xiao, Guoqi Xie, Renfa Li, and Keqin Li,

Recent Journal Articles
(最近学术期刊论文)



Professor Keqin Li's
current research interests include
cloud computing,
fog computing and mobile edge computing,
energy-efficient computing and communication,
embedded systems and cyber-physical systems,
heterogeneous computing systems,
big data computing,
high-performance computing,
CPU-GPU hybrid and cooperative computing,
computer architectures and systems,
computer networking,
machine learning,
intelligent and soft computing.


See [ORCID]
for a more comprehensive elaboration of Professor Keqin Li's scientific contributions.

Recent Journal Articles
(最近学术期刊论文)



Professor Keqin Li's
current research interests include
cloud computing,
fog computing and mobile edge computing,
energy-efficient computing and communication,
embedded systems and cyber-physical systems,
heterogeneous computing systems,
big data computing,
high-performance computing,
CPU-GPU hybrid and cooperative computing,
computer architectures and systems,
computer networking,
machine learning,
intelligent and soft computing.


See [ORCID]
for a more comprehensive elaboration of Professor Keqin Li's scientific contributions.

Keynote Speaker of

Exeter, England, UK, 28-30 June 2018.

Recent Journal Articles
(最近学术期刊论文)



Professor Keqin Li's
current research interests include
cloud computing,
fog computing and mobile edge computing,
energy-efficient computing and communication,
embedded systems and cyber-physical systems,
heterogeneous computing systems,
big data computing,
high-performance computing,
CPU-GPU hybrid and cooperative computing,
computer architectures and systems,
computer networking,
machine learning,
intelligent and soft computing.


See [ORCID]
for a more comprehensive elaboration of Professor Keqin Li's scientific contributions.

Hui Yin, Zheng Qin, Jixin Zhang, and Keqin Li,

(Security & Privacy in Social Big Data),

Recent Journal Articles
(最近学术期刊论文)



Professor Keqin Li's
current research interests include
cloud computing,
fog computing and mobile edge computing,
energy-efficient computing and communication,
embedded systems and cyber-physical systems,
heterogeneous computing systems,
big data computing,
high-performance computing,
CPU-GPU hybrid and cooperative computing,
computer architectures and systems,
computer networking,
machine learning,
intelligent and soft computing.


See [ORCID]
for a more comprehensive elaboration of Professor Keqin Li's scientific contributions.

Recent Journal Articles
(最近学术期刊论文)



Professor Keqin Li's
current research interests include
cloud computing,
fog computing and mobile edge computing,
energy-efficient computing and communication,
embedded systems and cyber-physical systems,
heterogeneous computing systems,
big data computing,
high-performance computing,
CPU-GPU hybrid and cooperative computing,
computer architectures and systems,
computer networking,
machine learning,
intelligent and soft computing.


See [ORCID]
for a more comprehensive elaboration of Professor Keqin Li's scientific contributions.

"COALA: A compiler-assisted adaptive library routines allocation framework for heterogeneous systems,"
IEEE Transactions on Computers,
in press.

Professor Keqin Li's
current research interests include
cloud computing,
fog computing and mobile edge computing,
energy-efficient computing and communication,
embedded systems and cyber-physical systems,
heterogeneous computing systems,
big data computing,
high-performance computing,
CPU-GPU hybrid and cooperative computing,
computer architectures and systems,
computer networking,
machine learning,
intelligent and soft computing.
